member.name: M:Hrm.Server.Data.DemoDataSetup.DomainName
member.remarks:
Pattern:
^((?!-))(xn--)?[a-z0-9][a-z0-9-_]{0,61}[a-z0-9]{0,1}\\.(xn--)?([a-z0-9\\-]{1,61}|[a-z0-9-]{1,30}\\.[a-z]{2,16})$
Explanation:
○ Match if at the beginning of the string.
○ 1st capture group.
○ Zero-width negative lookahead.
○ Match '-'.
○ Optional (greedy).
○ 2nd capture group.
○ Match the string "xn--".
○ Match a character in the set [0-9a-z].
○ Match a character in the set [-0-9_a-z] greedily at most 61 times.
○ Match a character in the set [0-9a-z] atomically, optionally.
○ Match '.'.
○ Optional (greedy).
○ 3rd capture group.
○ Match the string "xn--".
○ 4th capture group.
○ Match with 2 alternative expressions.
○ Match a character in the set [-0-9a-z] atomically at least 1 and at most 61 times.
○ Match a sequence of expressions.
○ Match a character in the set [-0-9a-z] atomically at least 1 and at most 30 times.
○ Match '.'.
○ Match a character in the set [a-z] atomically at least 2 and at most 16 times.
○ Match if at the end of the string or if before an ending newline.

The type of the value.
Property information containing metadata about the value.

member.remarks: Special handling is provided for: - JSON columns (using System.Text.Json serialization) - Date formats (using specific format strings) - Collections (checking for empty collections) - Null values (returning empty string)

member.summary: Generates a user principal name (UPN) for a Microsoft Entra user based on the provided format, domain, and worker information. If is null or whitespace, constructs the UPN using the template and worker properties. Ensures uniqueness by appending a numeric suffix if the base UPN already exists in . Returns the existing in lowercase if provided.
member.param: The format string for the UPN prefix, supporting placeholders: [FirstName], [MiddleName], [LastName], [PersonnelNumber].
The existing user principal name, if any.
The domain name to append to the UPN.
The worker record containing personal information.
Queryable collection of existing Microsoft Entra employees for uniqueness checks.
member.returns: A unique, lowercase user principal name for the worker.

member.name: M:Hrm.Integrations.Dataverse.Converters.DataEventMessageConverter.DateRegex
member.remarks:
Pattern:
^/Date\\(([+-]*\\d+)([+-]*\\d*)\\)/$
Options:
RegexOptions.IgnoreCase
Explanation:
○ Match if at the beginning of the string.
○ Match '/'.
○ Match a character in the set [Dd].
○ Match a character in the set [Aa].
○ Match a character in the set [Tt].
○ Match a character in the set [Ee].
○ Match '('.
○ 1st capture group.
○ Match a character in the set [+-] atomically any number of times.
○ Match a Unicode digit greedily at least once.
○ 2nd capture group.
○ Match a character in the set [+-] atomically any number of times.
○ Match a Unicode digit atomically any number of times.
○ Match the string ")/".
○ Match if at the end of the string or if before an ending newline.
